author: AFP - Agence France Presse
title: N. Korea Says US Sale Of Military Helicopters To South 'Reckless' | Barron's
text: North Korea on Thursday criticised recent US arms sales in Asia, calling a deal to deliver Apache helicopters to South Korea a "reckless, provocative act" and adding Pyongyang would build up its own forces in response. "We strongly oppose and reject the US and its vassal forces' arms buildup," North Korea's Foreign Ministry said in a statement, referring to the South. "This is a reckless, provocative act of deliberately increasing the security instability in the region," it added, also criticising recent US sales to Japan and other Asia-Pacific allies of Washington. The United States on Monday had announced its approval of a $3.5-billion sale to South Korea of up to 36 AH-64E Apache attack helicopters and related equipment, including missiles. The US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) said the sale would "improve the Republic of Korea's capability to meet current and future threats by providing a credible force capable of deterring adversaries and participating in regional operations", using the formal name for South Korea. The State Department approved the possible sale of the helicopters to South Korea, and the DSCA on Monday provided the required notification to the US Congress, which still needs to sign off on the transaction. Washington is Seoul's key security ally and stations about 28,500 troops in South Korea, with their role including helping to protect it from its nuclear-armed neighbour. Pyongyang also said on Friday that US arms sales in the Pacific would prompt "the DPRK's strategic deterrence" to be "further strengthened" in response. "The prevailing situation urgently calls for thoroughly ensuring the military balance in the region by increasing the defence capabilities in every way in direct proportion to security challenges and threats that may result from the US arms sales," it said. The Democratic People's Republic of Korea, or DPRK, is the formal name for North Korea. The helicopter sale announcement came on the same day that Washington and Seoul began major annual joint military drills, with new exercises aimed at containing the North. The Ulchi Freedom Shield exercise runs until August 29 and will involve thousands of military personnel. bur-nro/aha AFP.com . © Agence France-Presse

author: Sanjesh Singh
title: US men's rugby eliminated in Olympic quarterfinals, will not medal
text:
Team USA will not medal in men’s rugby in Paris .
The Eagles on Thursday fell to Australia 18-0 in their quarterfinal matchup , ending a chance to at least claim a bronze medal in the competition.
Australia will move onto the semifinals on Saturday, July 27, where it will play two-time gold medalists Fiji .
The Eagles, though, haven’t played their last game. They will play Ireland on Saturday at 9 a.m. ET in the first of two placement games.
2024 Paris Olympics Dec 13, 2023 2024 Paris Olympics: See dates, sports, how to watch and more 2024 Paris Olympics Dec 21, 2023 Here are the rules for the 2024 Olympics in Paris 2024 Paris Olympics Dec 20, 2023 Get to know Team USA Olympians ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympics They can finish the tournament as high as fifth place or as low as eighth place, depending on the result between New Zealand and Australia.
Fiji, Australia, South Africa and France are the four semifinalists, though one will not medal.
Team USA has not yet medaled in men’s rugby since it entered the Olympics in 2016.

author: EMILY VOLZ, NBC 10 NEWS
title: chevron-right
text: (WJAR) — Artificial intelligence is quickly transforming so many aspects of everyday life, including our smartphones. Believe it or not, AI has actually been a big part of our smartphones for years -- think of features like portrait mode, where it magically blurs the background of your photo. But, according to CNET Senior Mobile Editor Lisa Eadicicco, what we're seeing now is an [increase in generative AI features.](https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ai-is-changing-our-phones-and-its-just-getting-started/) “Generative AI is the type of AI that powers ChatGPT,” Eadicicco said. “It can provide an answer or create something in response to a prompt, and the way that we're seeing that in smartphones today is really through photo editing and some note taking features.” She continued, “So for example, both Samsung's new Galaxy S24 series and the Pixel 8 have features that can actually generate parts of a photo after you've removed an object to make it look more natural.” Eadicicco said there are also phones that can translate calls in different languages in real time. Over the coming years, she expects new features, powered by generative AI, to transform the way we use our phones. “One example of how we're kind of seeing that today in an early sense is a feature called ‘circle to search,’” Eadicicco said. “Now, this is pretty much exactly what it sounds like - on certain new Android phones - the Pixel 8 series, the Galaxy S24 series and some other phones from Samsung and Google - you can hold down the hold button and then circle almost anything on screen to launch a Google search for it.”' She said while that might not sound like a huge deal, it’s a new and different way of interacting with our phones. Eadicicco also talked about how increasing generative AI features on smartphones alter our current screen time habits. Right now, the average American spends an astonishing [4.5 hours a day on their phone](https://turnto10.com/i-team/consumer-advocate/screen-time-addiction-average-american-spends-four-hours-per-day-phone-younger-generation-reduce-laptops-notifications-january-22-2024) - and there's concern new, more appealing features will make the problem even worse. However, Eadicicco said there's also a chance that generative AI could eventually streamline the smartphone experience, so you don't open your phone to read an email and then feel compelled to open Facebook, and Instagram, and TikTok. But, like so many things in life, we'll have to wait and see.

author: Cubadebate
title: Helene se convierte en un huracán intenso mientras se acerca a la península de la Florida
text: Helene se convierte en un huracán intenso mientras se acerca a la península de la Florida El huracán Helene ha tenido una rápida intensificación sobre el golfo de México, convirtiéndose esta tarde en el segundo huracán intenso de la actual temporada ciclónica. Sus vientos máximos sostenidos se han incrementado hasta los 215 kilómetros por hora, con rachas superiores y la presión mínima ha descendido hasta los 951 hectoPascal; por lo que ahora es un huracán categoría cuatro de la escala Saffir-Simpson, de un máximo de cinco. A las seis y treinta de la tarde, el centro del huracán se estimó en los 28.0 grados de latitud norte y 84.5 grados de longitud oeste, posición que lo sitúa a 195 kilómetros al oeste de Tampa, Florida. Se desplaza con un rumbo próximo al norte-nordeste, incrementado su velocidad de traslación a 37 kilómetros por hora. La amplia circulación de Helene continúa generando bandas de alimentación que cruzan sobre las regiones occidental y central de Cuba, ocasionando lluvias y chubascos a intervalos en las provincias desde Pinar del Río hasta Villa Clara y Cienfuegos, incluyendo la Isla de la Juventud. También se reportaron vientos fuertes durante la tarde con velocidades entre 35 y 50 kilómetros por hora en la región occidental, con rachas superiores. En las próximas 12 horas el huracán continuará desplazándose por el este del golfo de México, manteniendo similar rumbo e incrementando su velocidad de traslación, ganando más en intensidad antes de tocar tierra esta noche por la costa nordeste del golfo del México en el Estado de la Florida en los Estados Unidos. Las bandas externas asociadas al huracán continuarán influyendo sobre las regiones occidental y central de Cuba, generando chubascos y lluvias a intervalos. Persistirán los vientos fuertes en rachas en la región occidental y se mantendrán las marejadas al sur de la Isla de la Juventud, el archipiélago de los Canarreos y en ambas costas de la provincia de Pinar del Río, con inundaciones costeras de ligeras a moderadas en el litoral sur occidental. La intensidad del viento irá disminuyendo gradualmente desde el final de noche de hoy, mientras que las inundaciones comenzaran a disminuir a partir de la mañana del viernes 27. El próximo aviso de ciclón tropical sobre este organismo ciclónico se emitirá a la seis de la mañana del viernes. (Centro de Pronósticos del Instituto de Meteorología) Lea además: [Brigadas de linieros se movilizan para recuperar sistema eléctrico en territorios afectados por Helene] - [Ante Helene, “se ha trabajado rápido, con coherencia y con precisión”](http://www.cubadebate.cu/noticias/2024/09/26/ante-helene-se-ha-trabajado-rapido-con-coherencia-y-con-precision/) - author: AB Newswire
title: San Jose Tow Service Revolutionizes Roadside Assistance Experience | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
San Jose Tow Service announced its unparalleled commitment to revolutionizing the roadside assistance experience for drivers in San Jose and beyond. With a steadfast dedication to excellence, innovation, and integrity, San Jose Tow Service stands as a beacon of reliability and professionalism in the towing industry.
Since its inception in 2000, San Jose Tow Service has been more than just a towing company; it has been a trusted partner for drivers in need, offering prompt and reliable services 24/7. The company's ethos of customer satisfaction has been the driving force behind its exponential growth and success, making it the go-to choice for individuals and businesses alike.
"At San Jose Tow Service, we believe in the power of innovation to change the world," said the Founder/CEO of San Jose Tow. "Our journey began with a simple yet profound mission: to offer unparalleled services that make a significant difference in our community and beyond. Today, we stand as a testament to that mission, continually striving to exceed expectations and set new standards in the industry."
What sets San Jose Tow Service apart is its unique blend of traditional values and forward-thinking strategies. The company's commitment to sustainability, community engagement, and ethical practices permeates every aspect of its operations, ensuring a positive impact on both its clients and the community at large.
San Jose Tow Service offers a comprehensive range of services to meet the diverse needs of its clients, including:
Flatbed towing
24-hour towing
Jumpstart
Tire changes
Car battery replacement
Gas refueling services
Lockout services
Motorcycle towing
Truck towing
Roadside assistance
Long-distance towing
Medium duty towing
Emergency recovery
Drop-shipment service
Forklift services
Container towing (20 and 40 feet)
Box truck towing
Tractor towing
RV towing services
Commercial towing
Heavy-duty towing
Semi towing
Truck and trailer towing
Crane service
Rotator towing services
Towing and recovery
Lowboy towing
San Jose Tow Service is committed to delivering the most powerful services for every vehicle, ensuring that clients can rest assured knowing their needs will be met quickly and efficiently. Whether it's long-distance towing or roadside assistance, the company's qualified team of professionals brings unparalleled experience and attention to detail to every job.
For more information about San Jose Tow Service and its range of services, please visit https://sanjosetowservice.com/ .
About San Jose Tow Service:
San Jose Tow Service is a leading provider of towing and roadside assistance solutions in San Jose, California. With a focus on excellence, innovation, and integrity, the company is dedicated to delivering prompt and reliable services 24/7. Established in 2000, San Jose Tow Service has grown to become a trusted partner for drivers in need, offering a comprehensive range of towing and roadside assistance services to meet diverse needs.

author: Eurosport_FR
title: Bayern, Real, City : Wirtz s'ouvre les portes des grands d'Europe
text:
Bayern, Real, City : Wirtz s’ouvre les portes des grands d’Europe
Par
Oscar JossePublié 26/12/2024 à 23:39 GMT+1
Le milieu offensif du Bayer Leverkusen, Florian Wirtz, va être une des attractions du mercato hivernal. Pisté par de nombreux gros, l’Allemand aura le choix de rester dans son club ou de découvrir de plus importantes écuries dès janvier ou l’été prochain. Pour l’heure, place au doute et aux négociations avec le Bayern Munich, Manchester City et même peut-être le Real Madrid.
Florian Wirtz a-t-il joué son dernier match sous les couleurs du Bayer Leverkusen ? Le brillant milieu offensif continue d’attirer les grands d’Europe et s’avance vers un mercato hivernal remuant. Pourtant, l’Allemand est loin de la fin de son contrat, qui se termine le 30 juin 2027. Mais ses performances récentes au sein d’un Leverkusen distancé d’une tête, mais pas encore lâché en Bundesliga, plaît au leader du championnat allemand, le Bayern Munich.
C’est un classique en Allemagne. Un joueur brillant est un futur joueur du Bayern. Et quand ce dernier est l’acteur majeur du titre des siens face à l’ogre bavarois la saison dernière, difficile d’échapper à la règle. Florian Wirtz avait étonné bon nombre de supporters en restant cet été sous les ordres de Xabi Alonso, il pourrait cette fois céder aux avances du club le plus titré d’Allemagne. Selon Sky Germany, le Bayern continuerait de pousser pour faire venir le joueur de 21 ans cet été.
Premier problème néanmoins, le prix. L’Allemand est actuellement évalué à 140 millions d’euros sur Transfermarkt, soit le 7e joueur le plus cher du monde. Il faudra donc aligner les 0, ce qui n’est pas dans les habitudes du Bayern qui a déjà enregistré l’arrivée la plus chère de son histoire à l’été 2023 en la personne d’Harry Kane (95M€). De plus, les intérêts divers pourraient bousculer l’avenir de l’Allemand plus tôt que prévu.
Rafraîchir City, rejoindre l’armada du Real…
Autre club au cœur des rumeurs concernant Wirtz, Manchester City. Les Skyblues ne sont pas sortis de leur crise de résultats et doivent se renforcer au milieu de terrain. Sous couvert de moyens illimités, et d’une politique de dépenses bien moins régulée qu’au Bayern, le champion en titre d’Angleterre pourrait entrer en action dès cet hiver pour attirer le numéro 10 à l’été. C’est en tout cas ce que relaye Bild avec comme argument phare, prendre la place de Kevin de Bruyne. Le Belge, en fin de contrat, brille moins et n’est pas certain de prolonger.
Mais s’il cherche de la stabilité dans les résultats, Wirtz pourrait aussi s’exporter en Espagne du côté du Real Madrid. Si les Merengue semblent intéressés, il apparaît plus difficile d’imaginer l’Allemand s’intégrer dans leur système de jeu et notamment dans un poste de numéro 10. Pour autant, toujours selon Bild, les ambitions du joueur, à savoir la Ligue des champions et le Ballon d’or font de la Maison Blanche une réelle possibilité. Au contraire du PSG, malgré la puissance financière évidente.
…Ou poursuivre le rêve allemand ?
Mais une option reste plausible. Celle de rester dans le confort qui est le sien au Bayer Leverkusen. C’est en tout cas l’ambition du directeur sportif, Fernando Carro, qui a bien conscience que le rêve est presque une illusion. “Ce sera difficile, il faut être honnête sur ce point. Ce n'est pas impossible, mais ce n'est pas ce que nous souhaitons” expliquait-il au moment d’évoquer un éventuel départ de Wirtz. Pas de conflit à venir en revanche, car le club souhaite également “savoir quel serait le souhait de Florian Wirtz s'il voulait changer”. Une histoire qui se terminerait, certes, mais avec le sourire.
Le jeune talent un temps pisté par Arsenal est un élément que Xabi Alonso admire. “C'est l'un de ces joueurs extraordinaires qui savent rendre hommage aux dix”, une belle manière de complimenter son joueur, mais aussi de séduire son ancien club, le Real Madrid. Le mois de janvier sera long pour Leverkusen qui entamera 2025 dans un choc contre le Borussia Dortmund, le 10 janvier.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: New York man arrested after 911 call leads to discovery of unresponsive woman, drugs and guns
text: Police arrested a man and seized handguns and drugs from a residence in Addison after a 911 call at which a woman had to be revived from an overdose. The Washington County Sheriff’s Office got a 911 call on Wednesday shortly after 8 p.m. from a man inside a house on East Side Road, who said gunshots were being fired and people were attempting to hurt him, the Maine Drug Enforcement Agency said in a news release. Deputies went to the home and called a man out of the house, who was identified as the caller, Andres Rivera, 40, of Lynbrook, New York. While talking with him, the deputies became concerned about the wellbeing of another person at the residence. Entering the house, they found a woman who was unresponsive and give her several doses of Narcan. She was subsequently brought to the hospital. Police did not provide additional information about her condition. MDEA agents got a search warrant based upon the belief that there were illegal drugs inside the East Side Road home. There, they seized two loaded 9mm handguns, suspected fentanyl, and crack cocaine with an estimated street value of $3,500, and $1,700 in suspected drug proceeds. They subsequently arrested Rivera and charged him with Class A, aggravated trafficking in Schedule W drugs (fentanyl and cocaine), and a Class D offense of filing a false public report based on the belief that Rivera made up the story about shots being fired when he called 911. He was booked at Washington County Jail.

author: latercera.com
title: Pardow responde acusación de Cariola por precios de la luz - La Tercera
text:
Esperanza Navarrete hace 19 minutos Tiempo de lectura: 2 minutos Ministro Pardow responde acusación de Cariola y le recuerda que ella “votó en contra” de estabilización de precios de la luz La presidenta de la Cámara de Diputados señaló ayer que, en el debate previo al proyecto que descongela las tarifas eléctricas, Pardow no habría entregado todos los datos necesarios. “Le pedí al ministro poder informar abiertamente cuál era el porcentaje del alza que se proyectaba. Y la verdad es que esa información nunca estuvo a disposición de manera precisa”, lanzó la militante comunista.
compartir Comentarios La tarde de este jueves, el ministro de Energía, Diego Pardow (CS), respondió a las acusaciones que emitió la presidenta de la Cámara de Diputados, Karol Cariola (PC), en medio del debate por el alza de las tarifas eléctricas que afectará a millones de hogares a partir de julio.
¿Cómo llegamos a esto?: guía para entender el alza de las cuentas de la luz Sumándose a los cuestionamientos que ya han hecho otros parlamentarios, Cariola señaló ayer miércoles que, en el debate previo al proyecto que descongela las cuentas de la luz, Pardow no habría entregado todos los datos necesarios. “ Le pedí al ministro poder informar abiertamente cuál era el porcentaje del alza que se proyectaba . Y la verdad es que esa información nunca estuvo a disposición de manera precisa”, lanzó.
Tras participar de una actividad en Punta Arenas, el titular de Energía respondió que “ las críticas son legítimas en la política , y cada uno puede utilizar esas críticas, digamos, antes de decidir en una votación”. Luego, recordó que la militante comunista votó en contra de la propuesta del gobierno para estabilizar los precios de la luz.
La presidenta de la Cámara de Diputados, Karol Cariola. Foto: Dedvi Missene.
“En el caso de la diputada Cariola, ella votó en contra . Supongo que la información que le fue proveída en su momento y las reuniones que tuvimos no fueron suficientes para convencerla , y eso es legítimo en una democracia. Eso pasa”, planteó.
La historia continua más abajo
Más sobre Diego Pardow Alza de la luz: la otra bancada transversal que pone “las manos al fuego (o al enchufe)” por Pardow y apunta a Marcel Hace 4 horas Pardow afirma que el gobierno está tratando de viabilizar recursos para aumentar subsidios eléctricos 26 jun 2024 Por el contrario, Pardow relevó las declaraciones de parlamentarios que habrían sostenido que “la discusión fue informada, fue transparente”. Entre ellos, mencionó a los senadores Juan Luis Castro (PS) y Loreto Carvajal (PPD); y a los diputados Matías Ramírez (PC), Eric Aedo (DC) y José Miguel Castro (RN).
“Yo también quiero destacar la velocidad y el ánimo constructivo con el que fue hecho: este proyecto fue diseñado en conjunto con el Congreso durante finales del año pasado , muestra que ejecutivos y Poder Legislativo pueden trabajar en conjunto en establecer estas soluciones”, subrayó.
Luego agregó: “Este proyecto de ley que, por cierto, entendemos que es una noticia difícil y que va a ser impopular comunicarlo. Es solo un primer paso y vamos a seguir trabajando ese mismo espíritu con el que fuimos capaces de sacar esta ley de estabilización”.
Monsalve contradice a Juan Andrés Lagos y afirma que le comunicó personalmente la decisión de removerlo de Interior Comenta Los comentarios en esta sección son exclusivos para suscriptores. Suscríbete aquí.

author: Dan Perkins
title: In praise of longevity
text:
In praise of longevity
WORLD NOTES | We have been blessed by deeply dedicated contributors and staff
Full access isn’t far.
We can’t release more of our sound journalism without a subscription, but we can make it easy for you to come aboard.
Get started for as low as $3.99 per month.
Current WORLD subscribers can log in to access content. Just go to "SIGN IN" at the top right.
[LET'S GO](/subscribe)
Already a member? [Sign in.](/member-login?redirect=articles/in-praise-of-longevity-1733888734)
What makes WORLD extraordinary? It’s the people who have poured their lives into this mission—people who believe in staying, building, and leading for the long haul. WORLD people stick around, and that longevity brings tremendous benefits that go well beyond professional experience. More about that in a moment.
Joel Belz’s long-term commitment was about longevity—and vision. From starting WORLD in 1981 to mentoring generations of journalists, Joel shaped the foundation we stand on today. He was our founder and remained active, even after his day-to-day leadership of the organization ended. Up next in that leadership line is Nick Eicher, whom Joel hired in 1990. Nick still leads the entire editorial output of the organization some 35 years later.
Even those who’ve moved on left their mark, making WORLD stronger. I assume that all organizations value longevity, and we know how blessed we are to have so many who have given huge chunks of their careers to this work.
Longevity with key people becomes even more important—and more difficult—when an organization is experiencing rapid growth and change, as WORLD has the past several years. That’s why we were so thankful when Lynn Vincent returned to edit WORLD a few years back. How often do you get a chance to add a seasoned editor from outside the organization who also has years of experience inside it?
Well, at least one more time, as it turns out.
I am very happy to tell you that Les Sillars has agreed to become WORLD’s editor-in-chief. With more than 20 years of service in different capacities with WORLD and a legacy of mentoring top-notch journalists at Patrick Henry College, Les embodies the excellence and faithfulness we strive for. Longevity! He has been with Patrick Henry nearly as long as he has WORLD, and the high-performing journalists who graduate from PHC tell the story of Les’ work there.
A few years ago, Les began producing WORLD’s podcast extra, Doubletake, with his journalism students at PHC. He is eager to become much more involved in the day-to-day of our entire editorial team, and the team is looking forward to his leadership.
In addition to taking on the editor-in-chief role, Les also will be taking over for Lynn Vincent as executive editor of WORLD Magazine. You’ll still see Lynn in every magazine issue in her Voices column, but Lynn is going to be focusing most of her energy on WORLD’s expanded training and professional development program, which I’ll tell you more about another time.
Along with news of Les Sillars’ arrival and Lynn’s move, I must let you know of the departure of another editor who has served you here at WORLD for nearly two decades.
Mickey McLean has been a staff editor at WORLD for 17 years, but even before he joined our staff he was one of the primary contributors to worldmagblog.com, one of our early opinion and commentary ventures. Mickey won our Best Blogger contest in 2005, and when we wanted to start a serious online initiative, naturally we turned to him.
Since then, he has devoted most of his energy to the various iterations of our website and other digital products. He led the biweekly production of WORLD’s iPad app before smartphones made that app all but obsolete. As WORLD has become more digital and less papery, we’ve all relied on Mickey’s faithful guidance, as we did at the beginning.
Mickey inaugurated another important role at WORLD, that of audience engagement editor. In that role, Mickey responded with wisdom, kindness, and intelligence to every letter and email we received from our audience. You may have been one of those. If you were, you know the care with which Mickey responded, and directed others to respond.
Mickey is retiring from WORLD to care for his wife, Tammie, who was diagnosed with a rare form of Alzheimer’s a few years ago. Those of us who have worked with Mickey all these years will miss him, but I hope you will see him from time to time even after he steps down at the end of January.

author: @SpinPh
title: MPBL: Nueva Ecija, Quezon Province batter separate foes
text: [Nueva Ecija](https://www.spin.ph/tag/nueva-ecija) battered South Cotabato, 94-75, on Friday in Season 6 of the [Maharlika Pilipinas Basketball League (MPBL)](https://www.spin.ph/tag/mpbl) at the Orion Sports Complex in Bataan. Powered by [Robby Celiz](https://www.spin.ph/tag/robby-celiz), the Rice Vanguards led by as many as 77-52 early in the fourth quarter and never wavered en route to their 21st win against 3 losses in the round-robin elimination phase of the 29-team tournament. Celiz posted 20 points, six rebounds and rebounds assists to clinch best player honors over MJ Ayaay with 13 points and Jay Collado who finished with 12 points. Kenneth Mocon and JC Cullar added 10 points each for the 2022 MPBL champions. South Cotabato got 12 points each from Chris Dumapig and Jervy Cruz as they dropped to 15-11. Jammer Jamito grabbed 15 rebounds as South Cotabato ruled the boards, 50-37. Nueva Ecija, however, compensated with a high 53.7 field goal percentage (27 of 44) against South Cotabato's 32.4 percent (15 of 33) to stay within sight of North Division pacesetters San Juan (23-1) and Pampanga (24-2). Earlier, Quezon Province dumped Muntinlupa, 88-31 to climb to 19-5 and regain the top spot in the South Division. The Huskers held the Muntinlupa Cagers to an all-time low of three points in the second quarter and pulled down their victims to 7-19. Homegrown icon Topeng Lagrama led the Huskers with 16 points, highlighted by a perfect 4 of 4 triple shooting, followed by Gab Banal with 11 points, 10 rebounds and three steals. Judel Fuentes and Rodel Gravera added 10 points apiece. The elimination round takes a break to give way for the MPBL All-Star Game on Sept. 7 in Zamboanga City. The regular schedule will resume on Monday, Sept. 9, with a triple bill pitting Pasay against Bicol at 4 p.m., Caloocan against Quezon City at 6 p.m., and Davao against Quezon at 8 p.m. Get more of the [latest sports news & updates](https://www.spin.ph?ref=article_boilerplate) on [SPIN.ph](https://www.spin.ph?ref=article_boilerplate)
